lab10.cscd210Utils

Class FileUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab10.cscd210Utils.FileUtils

  • public class FileUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The FileUtils class for CSCD 210. This class will be used for reading and writing from and to input and output files NOTE: All parameters will be final and all preconditions will be enforced

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileUtils()
      Don't write this it is provided by the API for free

    • Method Detail

      • openInputFile

        public static java.io.File openInputFile(java.lang.String[] args)
        This openInputFile takes the array of command line arguments known as args This method presumes that the filename will be in args[0] This method will attempt to create a new File of args[0]. If args[0] does not exist as a filename then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Parameters:
        args - Representing the array of command line arguments
        Returns:
        File Representing a file that exists and is open
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if args is null, or args.length is less 1

      • countRecords

        public static int countRecords(java.util.Scanner fin,
                               int linesPerRecord)
        The countRecords counts the number of lines in the file. Once the number of lines is determined then that value is checked for 0 or that number mod linesPerRecord does not equal zero. If all checks are passed then count divided by linesPerRecord is returned.
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing the open Scanner object to the input file
        linesPerRecord - The number of lines that make up an individual record
        Returns:
        int Representing the number of records in the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null or linesPerRecord is less than 1
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if count is 0 or count mod linesPerRecord does not equal 0

      • displayFile

        public static void displayFile(int num,
                               java.util.Scanner fin,
                               int linesPerRecord)
        This displayFile method reads from the input file for the number of records and the number of lines per record. This information is written back to the screen.
        Parameters:
        num - The number of records in the file
        fin - The open Scanner object to the file
        linesPerRecord - The number of lines in the file that make an individual record
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if num is less than 1 or fin is null or linesPerRecord is less than 1

      • openInputFile

        public static java.io.File openInputFile(java.util.Scanner kb)
        This openInputFile method receives a Scanner object. It prompts the user to enter the name of an input file. Next the method tries to open the that filename as a file. If the filename does not exist then the method re-prompts the user until a valid filename is received.
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        Returns:
        File Representing a file that exists and is open
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • readFileName

        public static java.lang.String readFileName(java.util.Scanner kb,
                                            java.lang.String type)
        This readFileName method prompts the user to enter a file name for the given type. The filename is read in and returned. The input buffer will be cleaned by the end of the function
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner object to the keyboard
        type - Representing the String for the file type (input or output usually)
        Returns:
        String Representing the filename as a String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null, or type is null or type is empty

      • openInputFile

        public static java.io.File openInputFile(java.lang.String fn)
        This openInputFile method is passed a String. The method attempts to create a new File based on the filename that is passed in. If the File exists it is returned. If the file does not exist then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Parameters:
        fn - Representing the filename that will attempt to be opened
        Returns:
        File Representing a file that exists and is open
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the filename is null or is empty or if the file does not exist after the attempt to open that filename

      • displayFile

        public static void displayFile(java.util.Scanner fin)
        This displayFile method receives a Scanner object. The method reads from the file until the file no longer has tokens, and writes that output to the screen.
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing the Scanner object for a file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null

      • openOutputFile

        public static java.io.File openOutputFile(java.lang.String fn)
        This openOutputFile method receives a String representing the filename. The method creates a new File and returns that new File.
        Parameters:
        fn - Representing the String with the filename
        Returns:
        File Representing the File for an output file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String is null or is empty

      • displayFile

        public static void displayFile(java.util.Scanner fin,
                               java.io.PrintStream fout)
        This displayFile method receives a Scanner object and a PrintStream object. This methods simple reads from the Scanner object (until there are no longer tokens) and writes the results to the PrintStream object
        Parameters:
        fin - Representing the Scanner object for a file
        fout - Representing a PrintStream object which may be an output file or the screen (System.out)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fin is null or fout is null

      • openOutputFile

        public static java.io.PrintStream openOutputFile(java.io.File outf)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        This openOutputFile receives a File object. This method creates a new PrintStream object from the passed in File object. This method must have throws Exception on the method header to quiet the compiler because of a potential FileNotFoundException.
        Parameters:
        outf - Representing the File which contains the information about the output file
        Returns:
        PrintStream Representing the created and open output file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - To quiet the compiler
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if File object passed in is null
